column2: meier, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: i did not know that the fish oils in this prescription were from natural sources.  That means that mercury could be in them since all fish have mercury build up.  On their website it says it is between .001 and .025 and that is less than the EPA's 1 ppm.  However, you take this pill every day.  Is the mercury leaving your body or building up?  There are alternate ways to get fish oil that does not have any mercury.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm hoping to get pregnant in the next year and my doctor recommended that I start taking Primacare One.  I feel great!  I am regular and haven't struggled with stomach bloating, diarrhea or nausea.  These prenatal vitamins are better than the multivitamins I was taking before.  Plus my hair is extra healthy and shiny.  I recommend following the directions and waiting 1 hour before eating or 2 hours after eating and definintely avoiding dairy.  Try taking it an hour before bed with a full glass of water for the best results.  All I know is that I'm taking care of my body for my future baby!

column2: Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I like this pill - it's easy to swallow and you don't taste anything going down. Not doubting anyone, but some women are sick with or without vitamins, or no matter what brand they are taking.

column2: lbe03e, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: At first, PrimaCare was great.  It was much easier to swallow than others I'd tried without any aftertaste.  It also cleared my constipation.
